note:
I'm a #hacker. Question my use of that term? Well I have been in the truest sense of that term since I was a young kid. I'm also a #CISO, 25+ years in tech have been good to me overall. I serve on multiple boards as well, back to that whole "tech has treated me well thing". I'm fortunate to be an Internationally recognized Public #Speaker and the Author of "Cyber Security Career Guide". I do my level best to give back to this community.

I'm also a #pilot and love #aviation. I live in the northern Midwest of the US so if I want good #BBQ I gotta make it myself, and that's just what I do.

If you're reading an opinion I posted I assure you it's mine and does not reflect the views of my employer or any organizations I'm affiliated with.

My pronouns are she/her, and if my listing that bothers you, GTFOH right now.

Come for the #infosec, stay for #HackerFlightSchool, and eat all the #HackerBBQ

Definitely Not a Parody Account, although I did stay at a Holiday Inn Express last night.

note: the map blog

What’s a Map in the Wild? It’s a map in a real life context, a sign, a poster, an object, perhaps quirky, perhaps unexpected. What it isn’t is a screen grab from a web site, the output from a GIS or similar. Context is everything and the more bizarre the better!

You can submit Maps in the Wild by messaging us here, using the hashtag #MapsintheWild or emailing us at maps at mappery dot org

He, him, his. Lent, Easter, Pentecost. Vote, help others vote, vote out vote suppressors.
The San Francisco fog. All that is sunny does not glitter, not all those in the fog are lost.

This is the official Mastodon account for Democrats Abroad, the Democratic Party arm for the millions of Americans living outside the US. We strive to provide Americans abroad with a Democratic voice in our government and to elect Democratic candidates by mobilizing the overseas vote.

If you're a US citizen who lives abroad, YOU CAN VOTE in the upcoming #2024Election.

To register, or get overseas voting information for your state, go to http://VoteFromAbroad.org.

We post daily.

Prof at Western Washington U Digital Nomad from Vancouver, BC Canada and Bellingham, Washington #indigenous #firstnations #indigeneity #reconciliation #canadatwitter #cdnpoli #bcpoli
http://www.reconciliationovercoffee.com

Mountains are made of rocks!
Associate Professor of Geology at WWU in Bellingham, WA.

note:
Father of two, traveler, craft beer and brewery nerd, software developer nearing retirement. I moved to Bellingham Washington in 2023 after suffering through 35 Texas summers and more before that in Oklahoma.

I enjoy hiking, photography, and visiting breweries wherever I live and travel.

Currently exploring a linear timeline in Bellingham, WA. Before that was Bozeman, MT and before that, upstate NY.

Previous life as an EMT, now living in the domain of #DevOps.

Too many interests and not enough time.

I like to #ski, #run, #ferment, #compute, #photograph, #cook, #explore, #read, and #grow. I do my darnedest to shift my lifestyle towards #sustainability and #reduce my impact. My latest focus includes #rust, #strongtowns, and #permacomputing.

#46er #vegan

note: LinuxFest Northwest (est. 2000), an annual Open Source event co-produced by Bellingham Linux Users Group and the Information Technology department at BTC. LFNW features presentations and exhibits on free and open source topics, as well as Linux distributions & applications, InfoSec, and privacy; something for everyone from the novice to the professional!
